CatDescriptText: Miss Madeline Roberson, senior, Schenley High School, 1080 Fisher Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that American citizens should receive Russia's first deputy premier, Anastas I. Mikoyan hospitably, or deport themselves in unhospitable fashion like some have done in several cities where Mikoyan has visited?" answer reads: �I guess that he should be treated just like any other normal visitor. In my opinion, Russia has not done anything bad to us in the last few years.  We in America go to Russia and are treated nicely, so therefore their citizens should be treated the same when they visit here.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Madeline Roberson, wearing light colored patterned head scarf and coat with plush collar, holding object, standing with man on left, in front of shrubs and brick building with three arched windows
